nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A new social circle pushes limits — jokes that feel mean, dares that pressure you.

nodes.speaker: Player
nodes.text: They ask you to join in. Do you go along, step back, or call it out?

choices.text: Politely step away and don't participate.
Call them out and say it's not okay.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: You feel a short burst of belonging, followed by a quiet regret.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A few notice and respect your boundary; some drift away, but you feel steadier.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: It's uncomfortable, but some peers think and later apologize. You earn respect and a cost.

nodes.speaker: Player
nodes.text: Fitting in can ask for compromises. Standing up for what feels right shapes who you are.
